Class Wolf

java.lang.Object
com.example.projectfx.species.Species
com.example.projectfx.species.Carnivore
com.example.projectfx.species.Wolf
All Implemented Interfaces:
Movable, Reproducible, Sleepable
public class Wolf extends Carnivore
The Wolf class represents a carnivorous species of wolf in the ecosystem. This class extends from the Carnivore class, which defines the general behavior of carnivores. A wolf can have pack instincts, hunt prey alone or in a pack, and reproduce under specific conditions. Wolves also have the ability to move, sleep, and manage energy consumption.

  • Constructor Details

    • Wolf

      public Wolf(String name, int energy, Positionn positionn, Environment environment, boolean packInstinct, int vitesse, javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
      Constructs a new Wolf with the specified attributes. This constructor initializes the wolf's name, energy, position, environment, pack instinct, movement speed, and image representation. It also increments the global wolf count.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the wolf.
      energy - The initial energy of the wolf.
      positionn - The position of the wolf in the environment.
      environment - The environment the wolf belongs to.
      packInstinct - Whether the wolf hunts in a pack.
      vitesse - The movement speed of the wolf.
      imageView - The image representation of the wolf.

  • Method Details

    • hasPackInstinct

      public boolean hasPackInstinct()
      Gets whether the wolf hunts in a pack.
      Returns:
      True if the wolf hunts in a pack, false otherwise.

    • setPackInstinct

      public void setPackInstinct(boolean packInstinct)
      Sets whether the wolf hunts in a pack.
      Parameters:
      packInstinct - True if the wolf hunts in a pack, false otherwise.

    • eat

      public void eat(Object food)
      Method for eating, but currently does nothing as the specifics are handled in the parent class.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      food - The food to be consumed.

    • move

      public void move(String direction)
      Moves the wolf in a specific direction. Consumes 8 energy units during movement.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      Specified by:
      move in class Carnivore
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction the wolf will move.

    • getNbwolf

      public static int getNbwolf()
      Gets the current number of wolves in the environment.
      Returns:
      The total number of wolves.

    • setNbwolf

      Sets the total number of wolves in the environment.
      Parameters:
      nbwolf - The new total number of wolves.

    • reproduce

      public void reproduce()
      Wolf reproduction method. Wolves reproduce in packs and their population increases if conditions allow. If there are enough wolves, they can reproduce, and the total number of wolves increases.
      Specified by:
      reproduce in interface Reproducible
      Specified by:
      reproduce in class Carnivore

    • hunt

      public boolean hunt(Species prey)
      Wolf-specific hunting behavior. The wolf can hunt alone or with its pack, depending on the pack instinct. If hunting is successful, it prints a success message, otherwise prints a failure message.
      Overrides:
      hunt in class Carnivore
      Parameters:
      prey - The prey that the wolf attempts to hunt.
      Returns:
      True if the hunt is successful, false otherwise.

    • sleep

      public void sleep()
      Makes the wolf sleep to regenerate energy. Wolves regenerate energy efficiently while sleeping. If the wolf is already sleeping, it does nothing.
      Specified by:
      sleep in interface Sleepable
      Overrides:
      sleep in class Species

    • wakeUp

      public void wakeUp()
      Wakes the wolf up from sleep. If the wolf is already awake, it does nothing.
      Specified by:
      wakeUp in interface Sleepable
      Overrides:
      wakeUp in class Species

    • isSleeping

      public boolean isSleeping()
      Checks if the wolf is currently sleeping.
      Specified by:
      isSleeping in interface Sleepable
      Overrides:
      isSleeping in class Species
      Returns:
      True if the wolf is sleeping, false otherwise.
